content: I’m sorry but I don’t consider myself to be so ‘privileged’ to be in the tech industry. Sure, those in the tech industry make higher than average wages, but we have to work hard to maintain those wages — constantly learning new skills. We also do not have any guild to protect our professional status like doctors or lawyers do. Nothing is stopping anyone or everyone from competing with us in the job market, including overseas workers. In fact, our ‘privilege’ pails in comparison to the real privilege of those in the finance industry. If I only wanted money and privilege, I probably would have gone into finance to secure a privileged position as a Wall Street banker. Instead I have decided to try to provide real value to people through the craft of software development.
